title: Weight-Loss Drug Metabolic Dependency
context: A new class of weight-loss medications delivers clinically significant results — patients lose 15-20% of body weight. Adoption is the fastest for any drug class in recent history. But these drugs manage obesity rather than cure it. When patients stop, the majority of lost weight returns within a year. The medical system is creating millions of patients on indefinite prescriptions costing over $1,000/month, while long-term metabolic and body composition consequences remain understudied.
hypothesis: Pharmaceutical weight-loss interventions solve obesity by helping people lose weight safely and sustainably.

chain.root: Prescribe weight-loss drugs at population scale

children.label: Cardiovascular risk markers improve in the short term
Patients attribute success to the drug, not behavior change

effects.label: Weight regain upon discontinuation
effects.impact: Majority of weight regained within 12 months of stopping

children.label: Patients become psychologically dependent on continued prescriptions
Weight cycling may carry its own health risks independent of stable weight
Lifetime drug dependency becomes the default treatment model

effects.label: Lean muscle mass lost alongside fat
effects.impact: 25-40% of weight lost is lean tissue, not fat

children.label: Reduced metabolic rate makes future weight management harder without the drug
Muscle loss increases frailty risk, especially in older patients
Functional strength and mobility may decline
Insurance systems strain under lifetime prescriptions for millions of patients
Access gap widens — only insured or wealthy patients can afford ongoing treatment

impact.after: 25-40% of weight lost is lean tissue

dontIf: You're seeking a short-term fix without commitment to long-term lifestyle changes
You have a history of disordered eating or body dysmorphia
ifYouMust: Combine with resistance training to preserve muscle mass — this is critical
Work with a nutrition professional to build sustainable eating habits during treatment
Plan for gradual dose reduction rather than abrupt discontinuation
Monitor body composition (lean mass vs fat), not just total weight

alternatives.name: Structured resistance training + nutrition
alternatives.note: Slower weight loss but preserves muscle and builds sustainable habits

alternatives.name: Metabolic health focus
alternatives.note: Target insulin sensitivity, sleep quality, and stress rather than weight alone

alternatives.name: Behavioral intervention programs
alternatives.note: Address the psychological and environmental drivers of overeating

falsifiability: Patients who discontinue weight-loss drugs maintain 80%+ of weight loss for 2+ years without medication

Drug costs decrease to under $100/month, making lifetime use economically sustainable at population scale
